thread.title: East Mississippi vs. Mississippi Delta college football game suspended due to brawl (video)
thread.title_full: East Mississippi vs. Mississippi Delta college football game suspended due to brawl (video)

author: Brent Axe | baxe@syracuse.com
title: East Mississippi vs. Mississippi Delta college football game suspended due to brawl (video)
text:
Comments 
A lengthy fight ended a junior college game between East Mississippi and Mississippi Delta on Thursday night. 
The game was considered a mismatch as Eastern Mississippi brought a 7-1 record into its game with Delta (2-6). 
East Mississippi had a 48-0 lead over Mississippi Delta in the final minute of the first half when both benches cleared and a fight ensued. 
An East Mississippi receiver was tackled out of bounds late in the first half. The player was shoved back to the ground while out of bounds, which instigated the fight. 
Video below shows the field covered with players fighting and chasing each other. 
Only at MDCC ... Posted by Darius LaRentrez Scott on Thursday, October 22, 2015 Mississippi JUCO game gets called at halftime due to an all out brawl pic.twitter.com/q7rcCQYuN2 — Barstool Sports (@barstoolsports) October 23, 2015 
Scott Walters of The Commercial Dispatch chronicled the scene on his twitter feed . Trash cans being thrown, players running wildly all over the field ... This has gone on for five minutes — Scott Walters (@dispatchscott) October 23, 2015 The game has been called due to "violent ejections" for both teams — Scott Walters (@dispatchscott) October 23, 2015 Stephens "I put this on us for our lack of discipline, the referees for not controlling the game and (Delta) for (it's) lack of discipline." — Scott Walters (@dispatchscott) October 23, 2015 Lack of security controlling this situation is amazing — Scott Walters (@dispatchscott) October 23, 2015 
Police eventually took the field and with the help of coaches and administrators regained control. Following a meeting, officials halted the game. 
Contact Brent Axe: Email | Twitter 
Information from the Associated Press was used in this report
